pronoun.description: Used by a speaker to refer to himself or herself and one or more other people considered together.
Used in formal contexts for or by a royal person, or by a writer or editor, to refer to himself or herself.
examples: in this section we discuss the reasons

pronoun.description: Used condescendingly to refer to the person being addressed.

origin: Old English, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch wij and German wir.
